name: Parea
headline: Test, evaluate & observe your LLM applications
description: Parea AI is the essential developer platform for debugging and monitoring every stage of LLM application development. We provide testing, evaluation, and monitoring in one unified platform. These capabilities help developers get visibility into LLM responses, quickly test and optimize prompts, and ensure customers get the best user experience.
tags: industry:developer-tools; industry:generative-ai; industry:saas; industry:devops; industry:monitoring; location:new-york

founders.name: Joel Alexander, Founder
founders.description:
Senior Software Engineer at Lyft.
J.P. Morgan TMT Investment Banking.
BA @ Columbia University.
MSc @ New York University

founders.name: Joschka Braun, Founder
founders.description: Published my first paper in the highest-ranked number theory journal at age 17. Continued to pursue math until my M.Sc. from NYU as a Fulbright scholar. Noticed AI has more real world applications than math and started researching applications of deep learning to medical imaging at Covera Health. Built semantic search systems and automatic code generation software at Jina AI.

# Test and Evaluate your AI systems
From experiment tracking, to observability, to human annotation,Parea helps teams confidently ship LLM apps to production.
Get Started for free AI Consulting
[Backed by![Y Combinator](https://assets-global.website-files.com/64754d86591b8cffd50b9e95/64c143736961eee448001d40_YC%20Logo%20Expanded%20%E2%80%94%20Orange.svg)](https://www.parea.ai/<https:/www.ycombinator.com/launches/J6N-parea-ai-datadog-for-llm-apps>)
## TRUSTED BY TEAMS AT

![Eval Trends Overview](https://www.parea.ai/eval_trends.png)![Compare score distributions](https://www.parea.ai/distr_score.png)![Compare experiments](https://www.parea.ai/exp-compare-summary.png)
### Evaluation
Test, and track performance over time. Debug failures. Answer questions like “which samples regressed when I made a change?”, and “does upgrading to this new model improve performance?”
[Docs](https://www.parea.ai/<https:/docs.parea.ai/welcome/getting-started-evaluation>)
![Manual Review View](https://www.parea.ai/annotation-queue.png)
### Human Review
Collect human feedback from end users, subject matter experts, and product teams. Comment on, annotate and label logs for Q&A and fine-tuning.
[Docs](https://www.parea.ai/<https:/docs.parea.ai/manual-review/overview>)
### Prompt Playground & Deployment
Tinker with multiple prompts on samples, test them on large datasets, and deploy the good ones into production.
[Docs](https://www.parea.ai/<https:/docs.parea.ai/platform/playground/compare>)
![Trace](https://www.parea.ai/trace_section_agent.png)
### Observability
Log production and staging data. Debug issues, run online evals, and capture user feedback. Track cost, latency, and quality in one place.
[Docs](https://www.parea.ai/<https:/docs.parea.ai/welcome/getting-started>)
### Datasets
Incorporate logs from staging & production into test datasets and use them to fine-tune models.
[Docs](https://www.parea.ai/<https:/docs.parea.ai/platform/test_hub/overview>)
## Simple Python & JavaScript SDKs
Python```
from openai import OpenAI
from parea import Parea, trace
client = OpenAI()
p = Parea(api_key="PAREA_API_KEY")
p.wrap_openai_client(client) # auto-trace LLM calls
# trace and evaluate any steps
@trace(eval_funcs=[...])
def func(...):
  ...
# run tests on datasets
p.experiment(...)
```
TypeScript```
import OpenAI from "openai";
import { Parea, patchOpenAI, trace } from "parea-ai";
const openai = new OpenAI();
const p = new Parea(process.env.PAREA_API_KEY);
patchOpenAI(openai); // auto-trace LLM calls
const func = trace( // trace step
 'funcName', origFunc,
 { evalFuncs: [...], }, // evaluate step
);
// run tests on datasets
p.experiment(...)
```

#### Native integrations to major LLM providers & frameworks

## Pricing for teams of all sizes
Get started on the Builder plan for free. No credit card required.
AnnualSave 20%
## Free
$0 / month
Get Started
  * All platform features
  * Max. 2 team members
  * 3k logs / month (1 mon retention)
  * 10 deployed prompts
  * Discord community


## Team
$150 / month
Get Started
  * 3 members ($50 / month per add'l. member up to 20)
  * 100k logs / month incl. ($0.001 / extra log)
  * 3 month data retention, (6/12 mon upgrade)
  * Unlimited projects
  * 100 deployed prompts
  * Private Slack channel


## Enterprise
Custom
Talk to founders
  * On-prem/self-hosting
  * Support SLAs
  * Unlimited logs
  * Unlimited deployed prompts
  * SSO enforcement and custom roles
  * Additional security and compliance features


## AI Consulting
Custom
Talk to founders
  * Rapid Prototyping & Research
  * Building domain-specific evals
  * Optimizing RAG pipelines
  * Upskilling your team on LLMs

![Eval Trends Overview⟨23⟩]![Compare score distributions⟨24⟩]![Compare experiments⟨25⟩]
### Evaluation
Test, and track performance over time. Debug failures. Answer questions like “which samples regressed when I made a change?”, and “does upgrading to this new model improve performance?”
Docs⟨26⟩
![Manual Review View⟨27⟩]
### Human Review
Collect human feedback from end users, subject matter experts, and product teams. Comment on, annotate and label logs for Q&A and fine-tuning.
Docs⟨28⟩
### Prompt Playground & Deployment
Tinker with multiple prompts on samples, test them on large datasets, and deploy the good ones into production.
Docs⟨29⟩
![Trace⟨30⟩]
### Observability
Log production and staging data. Debug issues, run online evals, and capture user feedback. Track cost, latency, and quality in one place.
Docs⟨31⟩
### Datasets
Incorporate logs from staging & production into test datasets and use them to fine-tune models.
Docs⟨32⟩
## Simple Python & JavaScript SDKs
Python```
from openai import OpenAI
from parea import Parea, trace
client = OpenAI()
p = Parea(api_key="PAREA_API_KEY")
p.wrap_openai_client(client) # auto-trace LLM calls
# trace and evaluate any steps
@trace(eval_funcs=[...])
def func(...):
  ...
# run tests on datasets
p.experiment(...)
```
TypeScript```
import OpenAI from "openai";
import { Parea, patchOpenAI, trace } from "parea-ai";
const openai = new OpenAI();
const p = new Parea(process.env.PAREA_API_KEY);
patchOpenAI(openai); // auto-trace LLM calls
const func = trace( // trace step
 'funcName', origFunc,
 { evalFuncs: [...], }, // evaluate step
);
// run tests on datasets
p.experiment(...)
```

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Parea**

**Founding Year:** 2023  
**Location:** New York  
**Team Size:** 2 Employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** S23  
**Key Partner:** Dalton Caldwell  

---

### Mission  
Parea's mission is straightforward yet critical: to test, evaluate, and observe large language model (LLM) applications. They aim to empower developers through a comprehensive platform that combines debugging and monitoring at every step of LLM application development.

### What They Do  
Initially branded as Parea AI, Parea serves as an essential developer platform designed for testing and optimizing LLM applications. The platform integrates various capabilities—such as testing, evaluation, and monitoring—into a single interface. This holistic approach allows developers to:

- Gain better visibility into LLM responses.
- Rapidly test and refine prompts.
- Enhance user experience for their end customers.

Essentially, Parea acts as a safety net, ensuring that the applications built utilizing LLMs perform optimally before they reach production.

### Features
Parea offers a variety of functionalities tailored to AI developers, including:

- **Experiment Tracking**: Monitor performance and changes over time.
- **Human Annotation**: Gather feedback from users and subject matter experts for fine-tuning applications.
- **Prompt Playground**: Experiment with different prompts and deploy the successful ones.
- **Observability Tools**: Capture and log production data to troubleshoot issues efficiently.
- **Dataset Management**: Utilize logs from production for better model training and fine-tuning.

### Development Tools
Developers can easily integrate Parea into their workflows using simple SDKs for Python and JavaScript, which enable seamless tracking and evaluation of LLM applications.

### Pricing Plans
Parea offers a range of pricing plans:
- **Free Plan**: Perfect for small teams, includes essential features and limited usage.
- **Team Plan**: For $150/month, it allows for larger team collaboration with more expansive features.
- **Enterprise Plan**: Customized solutions for larger organizations with specific needs.

### Community & Support
Parea engages with its users through community platforms such as Discord and social media channels, ensuring that developers have access to support and can exchange knowledge.

### Conclusion
If you're in the realm of AI and working with LLM applications, Parea is one of those tools that can significantly ramp up your development process. By bridging the gaps in testing, evaluation, and observability, they not only soothe developers’ nerves but also lead to improved end-user experiences. For more information, check out their website at [Parea.ai](https://www.parea.ai).

This is the future of LLM application development, and with Parea’s help, you’re equipped to dive in confidently.
